required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness and Safety of a Flexible Family Visitation Model in Adult Intensive Care Units: a Cluster-randomized, Crossover Trial (The ICU Visits Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness and Safety of a Flexible Family Visitation Model in Adult Intensive Care Units: a Cluster-randomized, Crossover Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A cluster-randomized crossover trial involving adult ICU patients, family members, and ICU professionals will be conducted. Forty medical-surgical Brazilian ICUs with visiting hours <4.5 h/day will be randomly assigned to either a restrictive family visitation model (RFVM) (visits according to local policies) or a flexible family visitation model (FFVM) (visitation during 12 consecutive hours per day) at a 1:1 ratio. After enrollment and follow-up of 25 patients, each ICU will be switched over to the other visitation model, until 25 more patients per site are enrolled and followed. The primary outcome will be the cumulative incidence of delirium among ICU patients, measured twice a day using the Confusion Assessment Method for the ICU. Secondary outcome measures will include delirium-free days, ventilator-free days, any ICU-acquired infections, ICU length of stay, and all-cause hospital mortality among the patients; symptoms of anxiety and depression and satisfaction among the family members; and prevalence of symptoms of burnout among the ICU professionals. Tertiary outcomes will include need for antipsychotic agents and/or mechanical restraints, unplanned loss of invasive devices, and ICU-acquired pneumonia, urinary tract infection, or bloodstream infection among the patients; self-perception of involvement in patient care among the family members; and satisfaction among the ICU professionals.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The following interventions will be evaluated in the present study: restrictive family visitation model (intermittent visits according to local ICU regulation) and flexible family visitation model (12 consecutive hours per day). The unit of of concealed randomization is the ICU to minimize the risk of contamination, given that we intend to apply the intervention to the whole ICU multidisciplinary team. We will randomize ICUs to either an RFVM or to an FFVM as the initial intervention (T1). After enrollment of 25 ICU patients, there will be a 30-day period without recruitment to avoid contamination bias. After this period, each ICU will be assigned to an intervention contrary to that which initially receive (T2) until the enrollment of more 25 ICU patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Delirium among ICU patients
primary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from enrollment until ICU discharge, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of delirium will be verified by trained intensive care physicians and nursers with the confusion assessment method for the ICU 2 times per day.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from enrollment until ICU discharge, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Days alive and free of delirium during ICU stay.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from enrollment until ICU discharge, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of antipsychotic use during ICU stay

secondary_outcome.measure: Need of mechanical restraints among ICU patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from randomization until ICU discharge, or death, or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Need of mechanical restraints among ICU patients during ICU stay

secondary_outcome.measure: Unplanned removal of invasive devices among ICU patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from randomization until ICU discharge, or death, or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Unplanned removal of venous catheter, tube feeding or urinary catheter

secondary_outcome.measure: Mechanical ventilation-free days among ICU patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from enrollment until ICU discharge, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Days alive and free of mechanical ventilation during ICU stay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Any ICU-acquired infection among ICU patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from enrollment until ICU discharge, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Pneumonia or bloodstream infection or urinary tract infection acquired after 48 hours of ICU admission.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from enrollment until ICU discharge, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Pneumonia acquired after 48 hours of ICU admission.

secondary_outcome.measure: ICU-acquired bloodstream infection among ICU patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from enrollment until ICU discharge, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Bloodstream infection acquired after 48 hours of ICU admission.

secondary_outcome.measure: ICU-acquired urinary tract infection among ICU patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from enrollment until ICU discharge, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary tract infection acquired after 48 hours of ICU admission.

secondary_outcome.measure: Any ICU-acquired multi-drug resistant infection among ICU patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from enrollment until ICU discharge, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Pneumonia or bloodstream infection or urinary tract infection due to multi-drug resistant bacteria acquired after 48 hours of ICU admission.

secondary_outcome.measure: ICU length of stay among ICU patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from enrollment until ICU discharge, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Length of ICU stay in days

secondary_outcome.measure: All-cause hospital mortality among ICU patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During hospital stay (from enrollment until hospital discharge, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: rates of all-cause mortality during hospital stay

secondary_outcome.measure: Symptoms of anxiety among ICU visitors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: It will be measured in two moments during patient ICU stay (within the first 48hs of patient enrollment and on the day of ICU discharge, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: symptoms of anxiety among ICU visitors measured by de Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Symptoms of depression among ICU visitors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In two moments during patient ICU stay (within the first 48hs of patient enrollment and on the day of patient discharge from ICU, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up.
secondary_outcome.description: symptoms of depression among ICU visitors measured by de Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: On the day of patient discharge from ICU, or death or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up.
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of patient's families satisfaction measured by the critical care family needs inventory

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Burnout Syndrome symptoms among ICU workers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: It will be measured in two moments: within 15 days prior to the first ICU intervention and between the 15th and 30th days of the period in which no patient will be enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of Burnout Syndrome symptoms among ICU workers measured by the Maslach Burnout Inventory

secondary_outcome.measure: Any adverse event related to ICU visitation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During ICU stay (from randomization until ICU discharge, or death, or a maximum of 30 days of follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Any adverse event possible related to the ICU visitation model

arm_group.description: In the FFVM, two or fewer family members will be allowed to visit the patient for up to 12 consecutive hours each day. In addition to family visitation, patients will be allowed to receive social visits in specific time intervals (according local ICU regulation). To have access to the FFVM, family members of ICU patients will have to attend a structured meeting at ICU in which they will receive orientations about the ICU environment, common ICU treatments, rehabilitation and basic infection control practices, multidisciplinary work at ICU and palliative treatment. Social visitors will not be required to attend the structured meeting.

In the RFVM, patients will be allowed to receive restricted visits according routine ICU practices, but respecting the maximum limit of 4.5 hours of visitation per day. Visitors will not be required to attend the structured meeting. The length of ICU visits will be similar to those of social visits in the FFVM.

intervention.description: Visitation to ICU patients allowed during the period of 12 consecutive hours per day.
Visitation to ICU patients allowed during intermittent periods according local ICU regulation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- For ICUs: clinical-surgical brazilian ICUs with restricted visitation policies(<4.5 hours/day).
- For Patients: Age ≥ 18 years, admission to the intensive care unit.
- For Patient's Family Members: nearest relative of the ICU patient recruited in the study and consent to participate in the study.
- For ICU Workers: ICU workers that assist patients in the ICU during the daytime for at least 20 hours per week and consent to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- For ICUs: ICUs with structural or organizational impediments to extended visitation.
- For Patients: Subjects with coma (Richmond Agitation Sedation Scale -4 or -5) lasting > 96 hours from the moment of first evaluation for recruitment, or delirium at the baseline (positive Confusion Assessment Method for ICU) will be excluded. Individuals with cerebral death, aphasia, severe hearing deficit, a prediction of ICU length of stay < 48 hours, exclusively palliative treatment, or without a familiar member able to participate in extended ICU visits and those who are prisioners, unlikely to survive >24hs, re-admitted to the ICU after enrolment in the study will also be excluded.
- For Patient's Family Members: Another ICU patient's relative enrolled in the study; family members who don't speak Portuguese; Difficulty to answer the self-administered questionnaires (e.g.: illiteracy)
- For ICU Workers: ICU workers who have a prediction of withdrawal of ICU care activities >15 days during the study will be excluded.

patient_data.ipd_description: The datasets used and/or analyzed during the current study are available from the corresponding author on reasonable request.
